text: <extra_id_0> Epstein-Barr virus nuclear antigen 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transactivates latent membrane protein <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Several lines of evidence are compatible with the hypothesis that <extra_id_0> Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) nuclear antigen 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) or leader protein ( <extra_id_0> EBNA-LP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) affects expression of the EBV latent infection membrane protein <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

( i ) Acute transfection and expression of <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> under control of simian virus 40 or Moloney murine leukemia virus promoters resulted in increased <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in P3HR-1-infected Burkitt 's lymphoma cells and the P3HR-1 or Daudi cell line .

( ii ) Transfection and expression of <extra_id_0> EBNA-LP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone had no effect on <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression and did not act synergistically with <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to affect <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

( iii ) <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in Daudi and P3HR-1-infected cells was controlled at the mRNA level , and <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in Daudi cells increased <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA .

( iv ) No other EBV genes were required for <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transactivation of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> since cotransfection of recombinant <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression vectors and genomic <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> DNA fragments enhanced <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in the EBV - negative B-lymphoma cell lines BJAB , Louckes , and BL30 .

( v ) An <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - responsive element was found within the -512 to +40 <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> DNA since this DNA linked to a <extra_id_0> chloramphenicol acetyltransferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reporter gene was transactivated by cotransfection with an <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression vector .

( vi ) The EBV type 2 <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transactivated <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as well as the EBV type 1 <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

( vii ) Two deletions within the <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene which rendered EBV transformation incompetent did not transactivate <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , whereas a transformation - competent <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> deletion mutant did transactivate <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

<extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a potent effector of B-lymphocyte activation and can act synergistically with <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to induce cellular <extra_id_0> CD23 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression .

Thus , <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transactivation of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> amplifies the biological impact of <extra_id_0> EBNA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and underscores its central role in EBV - induced growth transformation .
